title: Southern Pecan Pie II
description: Experience the rich, buttery goodness of this classic Southern pecan pie, a cherished recipe passed down through generations. With its flaky crust and luscious, nutty filling, this pie is a stunning centerpiece for any dessert table that promises to delight every bite.
ingredients: ½ cup butter, chilled and diced
instructions: In a large bowl, combine 1 ½ cups flour, 3 tablespoons sugar, and salt.
Cut in chilled butter until mixture resembles coarse crumbs.
Mix egg yolk with ice water and stir into flour mixture until dough forms a ball.
Wrap dough in plastic wrap and refrigerate for at least 1 hour or overnight.
Roll out dough and place in a 9-inch pie plate.
Place pecan halves evenly in the bottom of the pie crust.
In a large bowl, stir together ¾ cup sugar and 2 tablespoons flour.
Mix in eggs, corn syrup, milk, melted butter, and vanilla extract until well blended.
Pour filling mixture over pecans in the crust.
Bake in preheated oven for 10 minutes.
Reduce oven temperature to 350°F (175°C) and bake for 40 to 50 minutes, or until the filling is set and the crust is golden brown.
Allow pie to cool completely before serving to let filling set.
tips: Use chilled butter and ice water to ensure a flaky crust. Avoid overmixing the dough to keep it tender. Watch the pie closely during the last 10 minutes to prevent the crust from burning. Let the pie cool fully for clean slices and perfect filling texture.

structured_content.content: This Southern Pecan Pie II is a timeless dessert that combines a flaky, buttery crust with a rich, gooey filling studded with crunchy pecans. The aroma of toasted nuts and vanilla fills the kitchen as it bakes, promising a comforting and indulgent treat that’s perfect for holidays or any special occasion.

structured_content.content: I first tasted this pie at a family reunion, and its rich, buttery sweetness instantly became a favorite. It’s a recipe that connects generations, reminding me of cozy afternoons spent baking with loved ones and the joy of sharing homemade desserts.

• Main ingredient: Fresh pecan halves provide the signature crunch and nutty flavor essential to this pie. Choose high-quality pecans for the best taste and texture.
  • Key seasonings/flavoring agents: Vanilla extract adds warmth and depth, while light corn syrup creates the perfect gooey filling consistency.
  • Supporting ingredients: Butter and eggs enrich the filling and crust, while flour and sugar balance sweetness and structure.
  • Equipment needed: A 9-inch pie plate, mixing bowls, pastry cutter or fork for dough, rolling pin, and an oven.

Preparation:
Combine dry ingredients and cut in chilled butter until crumbly. Add egg yolk mixed with ice water to form dough. Chill dough for at least 1 hour to relax gluten and ensure flakiness.
Cooking/Baking Process:
Roll out dough and line pie plate. Arrange pecans evenly. Mix filling ingredients thoroughly and pour over pecans. Bake first at high heat to set crust, then reduce temperature to finish cooking filling until golden and set.
Finishing Touches:
Cool pie completely on a wire rack before slicing to allow filling to firm up. Serve slightly warm or at room temperature for best flavor.

note.label: You Must Know
note.content:
• Preheating at 450°F helps set the crust quickly for a flaky base
  • Avoid overbaking to prevent a dry filling or burnt crust
  • Filling is ready when it’s golden and slightly jiggly but not liquid
  • Store leftovers covered at room temperature for up to 2 days or refrigerate for longer freshness

structured_content.content: This pie always brings people together at our family table, evoking stories and laughter. It’s more than dessert—it’s a tradition that celebrates heritage and the joy of sharing homemade goodness.

Enhance the pie by adding a pinch of cinnamon or a splash of bourbon to the filling for warmth and complexity. Toast pecans lightly before adding to deepen their flavor. For a richer crust, substitute half the butter with shortening or add a teaspoon of sugar to the dough.

Serve warm with a scoop of vanilla ice cream or a dollop of whipped cream. Pair with strong coffee or a sweet dessert wine for an indulgent finish. This pie also complements autumnal gatherings and holiday feasts beautifully.

For a gluten-free version, use a gluten-free flour blend for the crust. Vegan adaptations can replace butter with coconut oil and eggs with flaxseed meal or commercial egg replacers. Add chocolate chips or swap pecans for walnuts for a creative twist while keeping the pie’s spirit intact.

note.label: Pro Tips
note.content:
• Chill dough thoroughly to prevent shrinking and ensure flakiness
  • Use a pastry cutter or two knives to cut butter into flour for even texture
  • Bake on the lower oven rack to avoid burning the crust top
  • Brush crust edges with egg wash for a golden, glossy finish
